CARDINAL . The relevant parts of LAW provide :
“ CARDINAL . The members of parliament shall be elected for a term of DATE , commencing on DATE of the general elections ... ”
“ CARDINAL . A member of parliament shall not be prosecuted or in any way interrogated for an opinion expressed or a vote cast by him in the discharge of his parliamentary duties ...
CARDINAL . A member of parliament may be prosecuted only for libel , under the relevant law , after leave has been granted by ORG ... ”
“ During the parliamentary term members of parliament shall not be prosecuted , arrested , imprisoned or otherwise confined without prior leave granted by ORG ...
... No leave is required when members of parliament are caught in the act of committing a felony ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of LAW provide :
“ Persons who are entitled , under LAW , to compensation for damage for non - pecuniary harm and restoration of damage may join the criminal proceedings as civil parties ”

“ Anyone who intentionally fails to comply with a temporary order of a judge or court or with a provision of a court decision by which they are obliged to act or to refrain from acting ... may be punished by DATE imprisonment ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of ORG provide :
“ Whoever unlawfully and culpably causes damage to another shall be bound to make reparation to the other for any damage thus caused ... ”
“ In the case of an unlawful act , the court may , irrespective of any award of compensation for pecuniary damages , award reasonable compensation ... for any non - pecuniary harm suffered ... ”
CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of ORG also enable a court to punish non - compliance with a judgment or order by imprisonment or by a fine of up to MONEY .
CARDINAL . By virtue of LAW , a court may not order the imprisonment of a member of parliament during his or her mandate and for DATE after the mandate expires .

“ CARDINAL . CARDINAL . Within a fixed period set by the President of the ORG , the ORG shall prepare a report without examining the veracity of the accusation ...
